1. What is Claude Code? (features, capabilities)
2. How does it work? (architecture, AI models)
3. Pricing model
4. Key strengths and limitations
5. User reviews and common feedback

Use web search to find current information about Claude Code CLI. Provide a comprehensive summary.

Links: [{"title":"Claude Code Pricing | ClaudeLog","url":"https://claudelog.com/claude-code-pricing/"},{"title":"Pricing | Claude","url":"https://claude.com/pricing"},{"title":"Claude Pricing Explained: Subscription Plans & API Costs | IntuitionLabs","url":"https://intuitionlabs.ai/articles/claude-pricing-plans-api-costs"},{"title":"Claude Pricing 2025: full guide to Free, Pro, Team, and Max plans with updated limits","url":"https://www.datastudios.org/post/claude-pricing-2025-full-guide-to-free-pro-team-and-max-plans-with-updated-limits"},{"title":"Claude Code Pricing Guide 2025: Terminal-First AI Coding Assistant Costs – LaoZhang-AI","url":"https://blog.laozhang.ai/ai-coding/claude-code-pricing-2025/"},{"title":"Claude Code: Rate limits, pricing, and alternatives | Blog — Northflank","url":"https://northflank.com/blog/claude-rate-limits-claude-code-pricing-cost"},{"title":"Claude Pricing: A 2025 Guide To Anthropic AI Costs","url":"https://www.cloudzero.com/blog/claude-pricing/"},{"title":"Introducing Claude Opus 4.5","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-opus-4-5"},{"title":"Claude Code - Pricing & Plans | ClaudeCode.io","url":"https://claudecode.io/pricing"},{"title":"Claude Code Pricing: Is the $200/mo Plan Worth It? (New Rate Limits Explained) - UserJot","url":"https://userjot.com/blog/claude-code-pricing-200-dollar-plan-worth-it"}]

Here's what I found about Claude Code pricing:

## Claude Code Pricing Structure

Claude's pricing structure in late 2025 is built around four application-level plans—Free, Pro, Team, and Max—each defining access to models, usage capacity, collaboration features, and priority during peak demand.

### Subscription Plans

**Free Plan:**
- $0 - No Claude Code access, just basic Sonnet

**Pro Plan:**
- $17/month annually, $20/month monthly - Development + Research + Integrations
- Claude Pro includes access to Claude Sonnet 4.5 model and additional models with 5x usage limits compared to the free tier.
- 10-40 Claude Code prompts every 5 hours

**Max $100 Plan:**
- Max 5x tier at $100 monthly targets serious developers and small teams requiring consistent Claude Code availability throughout the workday. The 5x usage multiplier provides 140-280 hours of weekly Sonnet 4 access, effectively removing constraints for most individual developers while adding 15-35 hours of Opus 4 access for challenging tasks.

**Max $200 Plan:**
- Max 20x tier at $200 monthly caters to power users, technical leads, and developers working on large-scale projects requiring extensive AI assistance.

### API Pricing (Pay-Per-Use)

Claude Opus 4.5 (most capable): $5.00 per million input tokens, $25.00 per million output tokens.(no content)Claude Sonnet 4.5 (balanced): For normal context lengths (≤200K input tokens), $3.00 input / $15.00 output; for "long-context" requests (any request with >200K input tokens), $6.00 input / $22.50 output.

### Enterprise Pricing

Enterprise pricing remains deliberately opaque, with custom quotes based on team size, usage requirements, and contract terms. Organizations report monthly costs ranging from $5,000 for 20-person teams to over $100,000 for large engineering organizations.

### Cost Optimization Tips

For usage efficiency, employ strategic compacting to manage context costs, plan your sessions to minimize redundant processing, and use the /model command to switch between models and optimize cost per task type.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"claude-code/CHANGELOG.md at main · anthropics/claude-code","url":"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md"},{"title":"Introducing advanced tool use on the Claude Developer ...","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/advanced-tool-use"},{"title":"GitHub - anthropics/claude-code: Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that lives in your terminal, understands your codebase, and helps you code faster by executing routine tasks, explaining complex code, and handling git workflows - all through natural language commands.","url":"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code"},{"title":"Claude Code: Best practices for agentic coding","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices"},{"title":"Claude Developer Platform - Claude Docs","url":"https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/release-notes/overview"},{"title":"Code with Claude 2025 \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/events/code-with-claude-2025"},{"title":"anthropic-ai/claude-code","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@anthropic-ai/claude-code"},{"title":"Shipyard | Claude Code CLI Cheatsheet: config, commands, prompts, + best practices","url":"https://shipyard.build/blog/claude-code-cheat-sheet/"},{"title":"Claude Code overview - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://code.claude.com/docs/en/overview"},{"title":"A Guide to Claude Code 2.0 and getting better at using coding agents | sankalp's blog","url":"https://sankalp.bearblog.dev/my-experience-with-claude-code-20-and-how-to-get-better-at-using-coding-agents/"}]

Here are the search results for "Claude Code Anthropic CLI tool 2025 features capabilities":

## Claude Code Overview

Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that lives in your terminal, understands your codebase, and helps you code faster by executing routine tasks, explaining complex code, and handling git workflows - all through natural language commands.(no content)You can use it in your terminal, IDE, or tag @claude on GitHub.

## Key Features and Capabilities

### Core Functionality
- It will make a plan, write the code, and ensure it works. You can debug and fix issues by describing a bug or pasting an error message. Claude Code will analyze your codebase, identify the problem, and implement a fix.

### Recent Updates (from Changelog)
- Added Claude in Chrome (Beta) feature that works with the Chrome extension to let you control your browser directly from Claude Code.
- Thinking mode is now enabled by default for Opus 4.5.
- Added Haiku 4.5 to model selector. Haiku 4.5 automatically uses Sonnet in plan mode, and Haiku for execution.
- Auto-background long-running bash commands instead of killing them.

### MCP Integration
- Claude Code functions as both an MCP server and client. As a client, it can connect to any number of MCP servers to access their tools.
- You can use a checked-in .mcp.json file available to anyone working in your codebase. For example, you can add Puppeteer and Sentry servers to your .mcp.json, so that every engineer working on your repo can use these out of the box.

### Custom Commands
- For repeated workflows—debugging loops, log analysis, etc.—store prompt templates in Markdown files within the .claude/commands folder. These become available through the slash commands menu when you type /. You can check these commands into git to make them available for the rest of your team.

### Configuration
- Claude Code uses hierarchical settings stored in JSON files: User settings (~/.claude/settings.json), Project settings (.claude/settings.json), and Local project settings (.claude/settings.local.json).

### Subagents
- Subagents are specialized Claude instances with their own context windows and personas. Use them for domain-specific tasks (code review, debugging, architecture) to get better results and save tokens.

### Latest Version
The latest version is 2.1.3, published recently.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"what are the top 3 things Claude Code users strugg... · GitHub","url":"https://gist.github.com/eonist/0a5f4ae592eadafd89ed122a24e50584"},{"title":"My Experience With Claude Code After 2 Weeks of Adventures | sankalp's blog","url":"https://sankalp.bearblog.dev/my-claude-code-experience-after-2-weeks-of-usage/"},{"title":"Claude Code Limits Explained (2025 Edition)","url":"https://www.truefoundry.com/blog/claude-code-limits-explained"},{"title":"CLI reference - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://code.claude.com/docs/en/cli-reference"},{"title":"Is Claude Code Getting Dumber? The Real Truth About Switching to CodeX CLI","url":"https://apidog.com/blog/claude-code-getting-dumber-switch-to-codex-cli/"},{"title":"Claude Review 2025 - AI Flow Review","url":"https://aiflowreview.com/claude-review-2025/"},{"title":"Claude Code Changelog: Complete Version History","url":"https://claudefa.st/blog/guide/changelog"},{"title":"Claude Reviews 2025. Verified Reviews, Pros & Cons | Capterra","url":"https://www.capterra.com/p/10011218/Claude/reviews/"},{"title":"Claude Code 2025 Beta Pros & Cons Review - Skywork ai","url":"https://skywork.ai/blog/agent/claude-code-2025-beta-pros-cons-review/"},{"title":"Is Claude Pro Worth It? A Real-World User Experience in 2025","url":"https://www.gamsgo.com/blog/is-claude-pro-worth-it"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Claude Code CLI reviews, user feedback, and limitations in 2025:

## Key User Feedback and Limitations

### Usage Limits
"The most widespread frustration involves unexpectedly restrictive usage limits that interrupt development workflows."(no content)By mid-2025, Anthropic had redesigned Claude's usage policies, introducing a system of rolling hourly windows and weekly allocation caps across all interfaces — browser, API, CLI, and IDE extensions. These updates replaced the earlier open-access model and marked a shift toward governed resource allocation.(no content)The Claude Code experience is governed by a dual-layer usage framework: a five-hour rolling window that controls burst activity and a seven-day weekly ceiling.(no content)Unlike some SaaS systems, Claude does not provide detailed per-prompt or per-token breakdowns, requiring developers to self-monitor usage. For heavily sessioned workflows, teams often maintain manual tracking or use custom scripts to estimate remaining capacity.

### CLI Interface Limitations
"The terminal interface feels rough compared to full IDE experiences (one review noted the lack of UI elements, visual file management). Also, there are cost/usage ceilings, rate-caps, and you must be comfortable working in a CLI environment."(no content)Users have noted missing features like "checkpointing like the one we have in Cursor. I know Git exists but still Cursor checkpointing is too convenient."

### Performance Concerns
Developers across Reddit threads and tech forums increasingly question whether Claude Code has lost its edge. Performance complaints, context limitations, and inconsistent outputs spark heated debates about switching to alternatives.(no content)Context window management creates perceived inconsistencies. Claude Code maintains project knowledge graphs and Markdown-based chat histories, enabling cross-session memory retention. When these histories grow excessively large, the system struggles to prioritize relevant information, leading to seemingly "dumber" responses.

### Positive Feedback
The speed gains are real. One business review said that a project that would've taken three weeks was done in two days with Claude Code. Users found they could scaffold new functions or add tests in about half the time usually needed.(no content)Teams using Claude Code have reported 2× to 3× improvements in productivity on large-scale refactoring and testing efforts.(no content)Due to the CLI-based nature of Claude Code, it urges the user to do more exploration. It rewards you for curiosity. It might feel better for this reason for the nerds and power users.

### Recent Improvements
Recent updates include model switching mid-prompt with Alt+P, detailed context window information viewing, and file suggestion configuration settings.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text: Let me get more detailed information about the architecture and how Claude Code works:

input.prompt: Extract information about what Claude Code is, how it works, its architecture, key features, installation instructions, and technical details
Extract detailed information about Claude Code overview, how it works, features, capabilities, and architecture

content.content:
# Claude Code - Overview & Technical Details

## What is Claude Code?

Claude Code is an **agentic coding tool** that operates as a CLI (Command-Line Interface) within your terminal. It's designed to understand your codebase and help developers code faster through natural language commands.

**Key Description:**
> "Claude Code is an agentic coding tool that lives in your terminal, understands your codebase, and helps you code faster by executing routine tasks, explaining complex code, and handling git workflows - all through natural language commands."

## Core Capabilities

1. **Execute Routine Tasks** - Automate common development workflows
2. **Explain Complex Code** - Provide code comprehension assistance
3. **Handle Git Workflows** - Manage version control operations
4. **Multi-Interface Support** - Use in terminal, IDE, or tag @claude on GitHub

## Installation Instructions

### Option 1: MacOS/Linux Shell Script
```bash
curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
```

### Option 2: Homebrew (MacOS)
```bash
brew install --cask claude-code
```

### Option 3: Windows PowerShell
```powershell
irm https://claude.ai/install.ps1 | iex
```

### Option 4: NPM (Requires Node.js 18+)
```bash
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```

## Quick Start

After installation, navigate to your project directory and run:
```bash
claude
```

## Technical Stack

- **Languages**: Shell (48.2%), Python (32.7%), TypeScript (12.5%), PowerShell (4.5%), Dockerfile (2.1%)
- **Requirements**: Node.js 18+ (for NPM installation)
- **Package**: `@anthropic-ai/claude-code` on npm

## Architecture Features

- **Plugin System** - Extensible architecture with custom commands and agents
- **Codebase Understanding** - Context-aware analysis of your project
- **Natural Language Interface** - Command execution via conversational input

## Key Resources

- **Official Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/overview
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code
- **Community**: Claude Developers Discord (https://anthropic.com/discord)
- **Bug Reporting**: Use `/bug` command in CLI or GitHub Issues

## Repository Statistics

- **54.5k Stars** on GitHub
- **426 Commits** on main branch
- **48 Contributors**
- **1.3k Dependents**

## Data & Privacy

Claude Code collects **usage feedback** including:
- Code acceptance/rejection metrics
- Conversation data
- Bug reports via `/bug` command

**Privacy Safeguards**:
- Limited retention periods for sensitive data
- Restricted access to user session data
- Clear policies against using feedback for model training

For complete details, review the [Commercial Terms of Service](https://www.anthropic.com/legal/commercial-terms) and [Privacy Policy](https://www.anthropic.com/legal/privacy).

content.content:
# Claude Code Overview

Claude Code is **Anthropic's official CLI (command-line interface) tool** for agentic coding that integrates directly into your development workflow.

## Core Capabilities

### 1. **Build Features from Descriptions**
- Tell Claude what you want to build in plain English
- Claude creates a plan, writes the code, and ensures it works
- Fully agentic approach to feature development

### 2. **Debug and Fix Issues**
- Describe bugs or paste error messages
- Claude analyzes your codebase to identify problems
- Automatically implements fixes

### 3. **Navigate Any Codebase**
- Ask questions about your team's codebase
- Claude maintains awareness of entire project structure
- Integrates with external data sources via [MCP (Model Context Protocol)](/docs/en/mcp)
- Can access: Google Drive, Figma, Slack, and custom developer tools

### 4. **Automate Tedious Tasks**
- Fix lint issues automatically
- Resolve merge conflicts
- Generate release notes
- All from a single CLI command

## Key Features

### **Terminal-First Design**
- Works where developers already work—in the terminal
- Not another chat window or IDE
- Composable and scriptable (Unix philosophy)
- Example: `tail -f app.log | claude -p "Slack me if you see anomalies"`

### **Direct Action**
- Edit files directly
- Run commands
- Create commits
- Extend capabilities via [MCP](/docs/en/mcp)

### **Enterprise-Ready**
- Use Claude API directly or deploy on:
  - AWS Bedrock
  - Google Vertex AI
  - Microsoft Foundry
- Built-in security, privacy, and compliance features
- Support for corporate proxies, custom CAs, and mTLS authentication

## Installation

### Quick Start (30 seconds)

**Prerequisites:**
- Claude subscription (Pro, Max, Teams, or Enterprise) or Claude Console account

**macOS, Linux, WSL:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
```

**Windows PowerShell:**
```powershell
irm https://claude.ai/install.ps1 | iex
```

**Homebrew:**
```bash
brew install --cask claude-code
```

**NPM (Node.js 18+):**
```bash
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```

**Start using:**
```bash
cd your-project
claude
```

## Architecture & Integration Points

### **CLI Reference**
- Complete command-line interface with commands and flags
- Interactive mode with keyboard shortcuts
- Slash commands for session control
- Checkpointing for edit recovery

### **IDEs & Integrations**
- **VS Code** - Official extension with inline diffs
- **JetBrains IDEs** - IntelliJ, PyCharm, WebStorm support
- **Web** - Run tasks asynchronously on secure cloud infrastructure
- **Desktop** - Local or cloud execution
- **GitHub Actions** - CI/CD integration
- **GitLab CI/CD** - Pipeline integration
- **Slack** - Delegate tasks from Slack workspace
- **Chrome Extension** (beta) - Browser integration

### **Configuration Options**
- Global and project-level settings
- Environment variable support
- Terminal configuration optimization
- Model configuration with aliases
- Memory management across sessions
- Status line customization

## Advanced Features

### **Subagents**
Create and use specialized AI subagents for task-specific workflows and improved context management

### **Plugins**
Extend Claude Code with:
- Slash commands
- Custom agents
- Hooks
- Skills
- MCP servers

### **Model Context Protocol (MCP)**
Connect Claude Code to external tools and data sources beyond built-in integrations

### **Programmatic Usage**
Use the Agent SDK to run Claude Code programmatically from CLI, Python, or TypeScript

## Why Developers Love Claude Code

1. **Works in Your Terminal** - Integrates with existing workflows
2. **Takes Action** - Direct file editing, command execution, commits
3. **Unix Philosophy** - Composable, scriptable, piping support
4. **Enterprise-Ready** - Security, privacy, compliance built-in
5. **Auto-Updates** - Keeps itself current automatically

## Documentation Resources

- [Quickstart Guide](/docs/en/quickstart)
- [Common Workflows](/docs/en/common-workflows)
- [CLI Reference](/docs/en/cli-reference)
- [Security & Privacy](/docs/en/security)
- [Deployment Options](/docs/en/third-party-integrations)

Claude Code automatically updates itself and supports multiple deployment environments, making it ideal for both individual developers and enterprise teams.

toolUseResult.result:
# Claude Code Overview

Claude Code is **Anthropic's official CLI (command-line interface) tool** for agentic coding that integrates directly into your development workflow.

## Core Capabilities

### 1. **Build Features from Descriptions**
- Tell Claude what you want to build in plain English
- Claude creates a plan, writes the code, and ensures it works
- Fully agentic approach to feature development

### 2. **Debug and Fix Issues**
- Describe bugs or paste error messages
- Claude analyzes your codebase to identify problems
- Automatically implements fixes

### 3. **Navigate Any Codebase**
- Ask questions about your team's codebase
- Claude maintains awareness of entire project structure
- Integrates with external data sources via [MCP (Model Context Protocol)](/docs/en/mcp)
- Can access: Google Drive, Figma, Slack, and custom developer tools

### 4. **Automate Tedious Tasks**
- Fix lint issues automatically
- Resolve merge conflicts
- Generate release notes
- All from a single CLI command

## Key Features

### **Terminal-First Design**
- Works where developers already work—in the terminal
- Not another chat window or IDE
- Composable and scriptable (Unix philosophy)
- Example: `tail -f app.log | claude -p "Slack me if you see anomalies"`

### **Direct Action**
- Edit files directly
- Run commands
- Create commits
- Extend capabilities via [MCP](/docs/en/mcp)

### **Enterprise-Ready**
- Use Claude API directly or deploy on:
  - AWS Bedrock
  - Google Vertex AI
  - Microsoft Foundry
- Built-in security, privacy, and compliance features
- Support for corporate proxies, custom CAs, and mTLS authentication

## Installation

### Quick Start (30 seconds)

**Prerequisites:**
- Claude subscription (Pro, Max, Teams, or Enterprise) or Claude Console account

**macOS, Linux, WSL:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
```

**Windows PowerShell:**
```powershell
irm https://claude.ai/install.ps1 | iex
```

**Homebrew:**
```bash
brew install --cask claude-code
```

**NPM (Node.js 18+):**
```bash
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```

**Start using:**
```bash
cd your-project
claude
```

## Architecture & Integration Points

### **CLI Reference**
- Complete command-line interface with commands and flags
- Interactive mode with keyboard shortcuts
- Slash commands for session control
- Checkpointing for edit recovery

### **IDEs & Integrations**
- **VS Code** - Official extension with inline diffs
- **JetBrains IDEs** - IntelliJ, PyCharm, WebStorm support
- **Web** - Run tasks asynchronously on secure cloud infrastructure
- **Desktop** - Local or cloud execution
- **GitHub Actions** - CI/CD integration
- **GitLab CI/CD** - Pipeline integration
- **Slack** - Delegate tasks from Slack workspace
- **Chrome Extension** (beta) - Browser integration

### **Configuration Options**
- Global and project-level settings
- Environment variable support
- Terminal configuration optimization
- Model configuration with aliases
- Memory management across sessions
- Status line customization

## Advanced Features

### **Subagents**
Create and use specialized AI subagents for task-specific workflows and improved context management

### **Plugins**
Extend Claude Code with:
- Slash commands
- Custom agents
- Hooks
- Skills
- MCP servers

### **Model Context Protocol (MCP)**
Connect Claude Code to external tools and data sources beyond built-in integrations

### **Programmatic Usage**
Use the Agent SDK to run Claude Code programmatically from CLI, Python, or TypeScript

## Why Developers Love Claude Code

1. **Works in Your Terminal** - Integrates with existing workflows
2. **Takes Action** - Direct file editing, command execution, commits
3. **Unix Philosophy** - Composable, scriptable, piping support
4. **Enterprise-Ready** - Security, privacy, compliance built-in
5. **Auto-Updates** - Keeps itself current automatically

## Documentation Resources

- [Quickstart Guide](/docs/en/quickstart)
- [Common Workflows](/docs/en/common-workflows)
- [CLI Reference](/docs/en/cli-reference)
- [Security & Privacy](/docs/en/security)
- [Deployment Options](/docs/en/third-party-integrations)

Claude Code automatically updates itself and supports multiple deployment environments, making it ideal for both individual developers and enterprise teams.

content.text:
## Claude Code - Comprehensive Summary

### 1. What is Claude Code?

Claude Code is **Anthropic's official agentic coding tool** that operates as a CLI (command-line interface) within your terminal. It understands your codebase and helps developers code faster through natural language commands.

**Core Capabilities:**
- **Build features from descriptions** - Tell Claude what you want in plain English; it plans, writes code, and ensures it works
- **Debug and fix issues** - Paste error messages and Claude analyzes your codebase to identify and fix problems
- **Navigate any codebase** - Ask questions about project structure; integrates with external data sources via MCP (Model Context Protocol)
- **Automate tedious tasks** - Fix lint issues, resolve merge conflicts, generate release notes from a single command
- **Handle git workflows** - Create commits, manage branches, all through natural language

---

### 2. How It Works (Architecture)

**Terminal-First Design:**
- Works directly in your terminal (not a separate chat window or IDE)
- Follows Unix philosophy: composable, scriptable, supports piping
- Example: `tail -f app.log | claude -p "Slack me if you see anomalies"`

**Technical Stack:**
- Languages: Shell (48.2%), Python (32.7%), TypeScript (12.5%), PowerShell (4.5%)
- Requires: Node.js 18+ (for NPM installation)
- Package: `@anthropic-ai/claude-code` on npm

**Key Architecture Features:**
- **MCP Integration** - Functions as both MCP server and client; connects to external tools (Google Drive, Figma, Slack, custom tools)
- **Subagents** - Specialized Claude instances with their own context windows for domain-specific tasks
- **Plugin System** - Extensible with custom commands, agents, hooks, and skills
- **Multi-Interface Support** - Terminal, IDE extensions (VS Code, JetBrains), GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, Slack, Chrome extension (beta)

**Installation:**
```bash
# macOS/Linux
curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash

# Homebrew
brew install --cask claude-code

# NPM
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```

---

### 3. Pricing Model

| Plan | Price | Claude Code Access |
|------|-------|-------------------|
| **Free** | $0 | No access |
| **Pro** | $17-20/month | 10-40 prompts per 5 hours |
| **Max 5x** | $100/month | 140-280 hours weekly Sonnet + 15-35 hours Opus |
| **Max 20x** | $200/month | Power users, large-scale projects |
| **Enterprise** | Custom | $5,000-$100,000+/month based on team size |

**API Pricing (Pay-Per-Use):**
- Claude Opus 4.5: $5.00/M input tokens, $25.00/M output tokens
- Claude Sonnet 4.5: $3.00/M input, $15.00/M output (standard); higher for >200K context

---

### 4. Key Strengths

- **Massive productivity gains** - Users report 2-3x productivity improvements; one review noted a 3-week project completed in 2 days
- **Enterprise-ready** - Deploys on AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, Microsoft Foundry with built-in security/compliance
- **Direct action** - Edits files directly, runs commands, creates commits
- **Codebase awareness** - Maintains project knowledge graphs and cross-session memory
- **Composable** - Unix-style piping and scripting support
- **Auto-updates** - Keeps itself current automatically
- **54.5k GitHub stars** - Strong community adoption

---

### 5. Limitations and Common Feedback

**Usage Limits:**
- Dual-layer system: 5-hour rolling window + 7-day weekly cap
- No detailed per-prompt/per-token breakdowns available
- Limits can interrupt development workflows unexpectedly

**CLI Interface Limitations:**
- Terminal interface feels rough compared to full IDE experiences
- Missing features like Cursor-style checkpointing
- Requires comfort with CLI environments
- No visual file management UI

**Performance Concerns:**
- Context window management can cause "dumber" responses when histories grow large
- Some users report inconsistent outputs on large projects
- Model context saturation requires manual compacting

**User Reviews Summary:**
- **Positive:** Speed gains are significant; rewards curiosity; excellent for power users and "nerds"
- **Negative:** Cost/usage ceilings frustrating; rate caps interrupt flow; learning curve for CLI-averse developers

---

### Sources

- [GitHub - anthropics/claude-code](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code)
- [Claude Code Overview - Official Docs](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/overview)
- [Claude Code Best Practices - Anthropic Engineering](https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices)
- [Claude Pricing](https://claude.com/pricing)
- [Claude Code Pricing Guide - ClaudeLog](https://claudelog.com/claude-code-pricing/)
- [Claude Code Limits Explained 2025 - TrueFoundry](https://www.truefoundry.com/blog/claude-code-limits-explained)
- [User Experience Review - Sankalp's Blog](https://sankalp.bearblog.dev/my-claude-code-experience-after-2-weeks-of-usage/)
- [Claude Code CLI Cheatsheet - Shipyard](https://shipyard.build/blog/claude-code-cheat-sheet/)
- [NPM Package - @anthropic-ai/claude-code](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@anthropic-ai/claude-code)
